item.title: Eternal Ltd Forms Death Cross, Signalling Potential Bearish Trend
item.description: Eternal Ltd, a prominent player in the E-Retail and E-Commerce sector, has recently formed a Death Cross, a technical indicator where the 50-day moving average crosses below the 200-day moving average. This development signals a potential shift towards a bearish trend, raising concerns about the stock's medium to long-term momentum and investor sentiment. Time: 7 minutes ago

item.title: Swarnsarita Jewels India Ltd Forms Golden Cross, Signalling Potential Bullish Breakout
item.description: Swarnsarita Jewels India Ltd has recently formed a Golden Cross, a significant technical indicator where the 50-day moving average (DMA) has crossed above the 200-DMA. This development often signals a potential bullish breakout, indicating a shift in long-term momentum and a possible trend reversal for the micro-cap stock in the Gems, Jewellery And Watches sector. Time: 8 minutes ago

item.title: Dec 2025 Quarterly Earnings Reveal Mixed Market Sentiment with Mid Caps Leading Growth
item.description: The December 2025 quarterly earnings season has delivered a nuanced picture of corporate performance across market capitalisations, with mid-cap companies outperforming their large-cap counterparts in terms of positive results. While aggregate profit growth remains modest, sectoral leaders and select small caps have demonstrated robust financial metrics, signalling pockets of strength amid broader market caution. Time: 8 minutes ago

item.title: W S Industries Falls 1.31%: 3 Key Factors Driving the Weekly Decline
item.description: W S Industries (India) Ltd closed the week ending 30 January 2026 at ₹76.62, down 1.31% from the previous Friday’s close of ₹77.64, underperforming the Sensex which gained 1.62% over the same period. The stock’s week was marked by a downgrade to a Strong Sell rating, a shift in technical momentum from sideways to bearish, and persistent financial weakness, all contributing to a cautious market sentiment despite intermittent intraday gains. Time: 1 hour ago

item.title: SKM Egg Products Gains 10.42%: 2 Key Factors Driving the Weekly Surge
item.description: SKM Egg Products Export (India) Ltd delivered a robust weekly performance, rising 10.42% from Rs.179.45 to Rs.198.15 between 26 and 30 January 2026, significantly outperforming the Sensex’s 1.62% gain over the same period. The stock’s momentum was propelled by a stellar Q3 profit announcement and strong technical signals amid a broader FMCG sector rally, although it faced a minor pullback on the final trading day. Time: 1 hour ago

item.title: Prerna Infrabuild Gains 0.08%: 2 Key Factors Driving the Week
item.description: Prerna Infrabuild Ltd’s stock showed a marginal gain of 0.08% over the week ending 30 January 2026, closing at Rs.25.53 from Rs.25.51. This performance contrasted with the broader Sensex, which advanced 1.62% during the same period, highlighting a relative underperformance amid mixed financial signals and operational challenges. Time: 1 hour ago

item.title: Mahanagar Telephone Nigam Ltd Surges 17.09%: 4 Key Events Driving Volatility
item.description: Mahanagar Telephone Nigam Ltd (MTNL) delivered a remarkable weekly performance, surging 17.09% from Rs.29.02 to Rs.33.98 between 26 and 30 January 2026, significantly outperforming the Sensex’s modest 1.62% gain. The week was marked by extreme volatility, including a fresh 52-week low, strong intraday rallies, and an upper circuit hit, reflecting a complex interplay of market dynamics and investor sentiment. Time: 1 hour ago

item.title: eClerx Services Ltd Gains 7.85%: 5 Key Factors Driving the Week’s Rally
item.description: eClerx Services Ltd delivered a strong weekly performance, rising 7.85% from ₹4,314.50 to ₹4,653.25 between 26 and 30 January 2026, significantly outperforming the Sensex’s 1.62% gain over the same period. The stock demonstrated robust intraday strength, hitting near 52-week highs amid positive quarterly results, technical momentum shifts, and valuation upgrades, marking a week of notable investor interest and market confidence. Time: 1 hour ago

item.title: Brigade Enterprises Ltd’s 1.16% Weekly Decline Amidst 52-Week Lows and Mixed Market Signals
item.description: Brigade Enterprises Ltd experienced a challenging week ending 30 January 2026, with its share price declining 1.16% from Rs.760.85 to Rs.752.05, underperforming the Sensex which rose 1.62% over the same period. The stock hit multiple 52-week lows during the week, reflecting persistent financial pressures and sectoral headwinds despite some late-week recovery. Time: 1 hour ago

item.title: Mangalore Refinery & Petrochemicals Ltd Gains 13.61%: 6 Key Factors Driving the Rally
item.description: Mangalore Refinery & Petrochemicals Ltd. (MRPL) delivered a strong weekly performance from 26 to 30 January 2026, surging 13.61% to close at Rs.176.50, significantly outperforming the Sensex’s 1.62% gain. The stock’s rally was fuelled by a series of positive developments including a Mojo Grade upgrade, exceptional volume surges, and robust technical momentum, marking a notable phase of accumulation and investor confidence in the oil refining sector. Time: 1 hour ago
